'Shelton Jackson' "'Spike'" 'Lee' (born March 20, 1957) is an American film
director, producer, writer, and actor. His production company, 40 Acres and a
Mule Filmworks, has produced over 35 films since 1983.

Lee's movies have examined race relations, colorism in the black community, the
role of media in contemporary life, urban crime and poverty, and other political
issues. Lee has won numerous awards, including an Emmy Award. He has also
received two Academy Award nominations.
